p: Microalgae are a diverse group of photosynthetic organisms, including eukaryotic algae and prokaryotic cyanobacteria, which has formed our oxygen-containing atmosphere and remains responsible for a major fraction of carbon cycling which stabilises the Earth’s climate [ 1]. In addition to this immense ecological relevance, microalgae are also gaining importance as potential source of biofuels [ 2– 4] and high value products, [ 5– 7] or as tool to clean wastewater [ 8].
